title: Alan Pardew adds Neil Cutler to West Bromwich Albion coaching staff
description: Alan Pardew has added to his backroom staff at West Bromwich Albion, by appointing Neil Cutler as the club's new goalkeeping coach.
content: Cutler, who held the same role at League One side Walsall since 2013, will succeed Jonathan Gould who recently left Albion to rejoin Tony Pulis at Middlesbrough.Wolverhampton-born Cutler becomes the second addition to the backroom team following John Carver's appointment alongside Pardew in November.The 41-year-old began his playing career with the Baggies, but never played a first-team game, before going on to play for Stoke City and Rotherham United.He has since had coaching spells with Bury, Scunthorpe United and the Saddlers, before making the switch to the Premier League side.
